title: Who took home top honors?
text:
CNN Leadership
BET Hip Hop Awards: Kendrick Lamar, Big Sean grab top honors Updated 1916 GMT (0216 HKT) October 14, 2015 8 photos: BET Hip Hop Awards 2015 Kendrick Lamar nabbed three honors at the 2015 BET Hip Hop Awards, which aired Tuesday, October 13, including best video for the hit single "Alright" and best lyricist. Who else won? Hide Caption 1 of 8 8 photos: BET Hip Hop Awards 2015 Rapper Big Sean also took home three awards. He shared the People's Champ Award and best collaboration with Drake and Kanye for "Blessings." He also won best club banger for "IDFWU." Hide Caption 2 of 8 8 photos: BET Hip Hop Awards 2015 J. Cole was named best live performer. He also won album of the year for "2014 Forest Hills Drive." Hide Caption 3 of 8 8 photos: BET Hip Hop Awards 2015 DJ Mustard, who performed at the 2015 BET Hip Hop Awards in Atlanta, was named producer of the year and DJ of the year. Hide Caption 4 of 8 8 photos: BET Hip Hop Awards 2015 Drake skipped the 2015 BET Hip Hop Awards so could perform at the Austin City Limits Music Festival. He shared best collaboration for "Blessings" with Big Sean and Kanye West and won MVP of the year. Hide Caption 5 of 8 8 photos: BET Hip Hop Awards 2015 Newcomer Fetty Wap won best track of the year with producer Tony Fadd for "Trap Queen." He also took the "Who Blew Up" award. Hide Caption 6 of 8 8 photos: BET Hip Hop Awards 2015 Rapper Dr. Dre was named hustler of the year for his success with the Beats headphone line and musical biopic "Straight Outta Compton." Hide Caption 8 photos: BET Hip Hop Awards 2015 Dej Loaf took home the "Made You Look" award for best hip-hop style. Hide Caption
